com.jayeshtajane.simplejdbc.template

Class SimpleJdbcTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayeshtajane.simplejdbc.template.SimpleJdbcTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JdbcTemplate

    public class SimpleJdbcTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
implements JdbcTemplate

    This class stores the meta-data for connection. This class is not thread-safe. It will take care of all the connection related task. If you want to provide a database related operation then must need Query object. And this object is provide by the createQuery() method of this class.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jayesh Tajane
    See Also:
    Query

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleJdbcTemplate

        public SimpleJdbcTemplate(java.lang.String driverName,
                          java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String password)

        Create object using driverName, url, username, password variable.

        Parameters:
        driverName - - Fully qualified Jdbc driver class name
        url - - Database url
        username - - database username
        password - - database password

      • SimpleJdbcTemplate

        public SimpleJdbcTemplate(java.util.Properties jdbcProperties)

        Create object using java.util.Properties class object. That object must contains connection related keys like jdbc.driver, jdbc.url, jdbc.username, jdbc.password (optional).

        Parameters:
        jdbcProperties - - object of java.util.Properties having keys jdbc.driver, jdbc.url, jdbc.username, jdbc.password (optional) keys.

      • SimpleJdbcTemplate

        public SimpleJdbcTemplate(java.lang.String fileUrl)

        Creating the SimpleJdbcTemplate object using properties file. If you providing properties file then make sure in that properties file jdbc related keys you put. Those key are - jdbc.driver, jdbc.url, jdbc.username, jdbc.password If you are putting extra key in properties file then no problem its work fine but above key must be present.

        Parameters:
        fileUrl - - name or path of you properties file while have the following keys jdbc.driver, jdbc.url, jdbc.username, jdbc.password (optional).

      • createQuery

        public Query createQuery(java.lang.String sqlQuery,
                         java.lang.Object... params)

        Creating Query object and setting programmer user query, setting query parameter, connection details to the object.

        Specified by:
        createQuery in interface JdbcTemplate
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - - sql query which you want to execute
        params - - indicates the list of values that you want to replace with question marks of query. Order must follow.
        Returns:
        configured Query
